keyword: how many calories in tbsp of peanut butter
title: How Many Calories in a Tbsp of Peanut Butter?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in tbsp of peanut butter, including full nutrition breakdown, protein, fat, carbs, and easy tweaks for your diet.
h1: How Many Calories in a Tbsp of Peanut Butter?
assumptions: Natural, smooth peanut butter, no added sugar or salt; 1 tbsp ≈16 g.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, whether natural or processed, added ingredients, and serving size. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One tablespoon of peanut butter provides ~94 kcal and ~4 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in a tablespoon of peanut butter?
faqs.a: About 94 kcal for one tbsp of natural peanut butter.

faqs.q: Is peanut butter high in protein per tbsp?
faqs.a: Yes, ~4 g protein per tbsp, making it a good snack option.

faqs.q: How much fat is in tbsp of peanut butter?
faqs.a: Approximately 8 g total fat, mostly healthy unsaturated fats.

faqs.q: Does brand affect calories in peanut butter?
faqs.a: Yes—natural has ~94 kcal/tbsp; sweetened brands can be 100+ kcal.

faqs.q: Are there carbs in a tbsp of peanut butter?
faqs.a: ~3.5 g carbs, including 1.5 g fiber, so net carbs are low.
